subtitleNullable: 338 GB, 7 different attack types, iBeta Level 1 testing - face anti spoofing
descriptionNullable:
# iBeta Level 1 - liveness detection dataset

#The dataset was collected specifically for iBeta requirements for Level 1 certification of the Liveness Detection system.

# 💴 For Commercial Usage: Full version of the dataset includes 42,000 video attacks, leave a request on [TrainingData](https://trainingdata.pro/datasets/presentation-attack-detection?utm_source=kaggle&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=ibeta-level-1-liveness-detection-dataset-part-1) to buy the dataset

The dataset consists of more than **42,000 video attacks** of **7 different types** specifically curated for evaluating **liveness detection algorithms**. The dataset aims to incorporate different scenarios and challenges to enable robust assessment and comparison of **liveness detection systems**.

The iBeta Liveness Detection Level 1 dataset serves as a benchmark for the development and assessment of liveness detection systems and for evaluating and improving the performance of algorithms.

## Types of attacks:

1. **Outline**: printed outlines of people's photos.
2. **Outline3d**: printed portraits of people attached to a cylinder.
3. **Mask**: printed portraits of people with cut-out eyes in various variations.
4. **Mask3d**: portraits consisting of several connected cardboard masks.
5. **Phone**: demonstrations of a person's photo on the smartphone.
6. **Monitor**: demonstrations of a person's photo on a computer screen.
7. **Real**:  a real human face 

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F12421376%2F72c514066335ed6b6d1d273d1c4198ef%2FMASK_TYPES.png?generation=1678913343424357&alt=media)

Each attack was filmed on an **Apple iPhone and Google Pixel**. 
The videos were filmed on various backgrounds and using additional accessories such as *faked facial hair, scarves, hats, and others*.

The dataset comprises videos of genuine facial presentations using various methods, including 3D masks and photos, as well as real and spoof faces. It proposes a novel approach that learns and extracts facial features to prevent spoofing attacks, based on deep neural networks and advanced biometric techniques. 

Our results show that this technology works effectively in securing most applications and prevents unauthorized access by distinguishing between genuine and spoofed inputs. Additionally, it addresses the challenging task of identifying unseen spoofing cues, making it one of the most effective techniques in the field of anti-spoofing research.

# 💴 Buy the Dataset: This is just an example of the data. Leave a request on **[https://trainingdata.pro/datasets](https://trainingdata.pro/datasets/presentation-attack-detection?utm_source=kaggle&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=ibeta-level-1-liveness-detection-dataset-part-1)** to discuss your requirements, learn about the price and buy the dataset

# iBeta Level 2 Liveness Detection

### Try the iBeta Level 2 dataset: [Link to the Kaggle](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/tapakah68/pad-ibeta-level-2)

# **[TrainingData](https://trainingdata.pro/datasets/presentation-attack-detection?utm_source=kaggle&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=ibeta-level-1-liveness-detection-dataset-part-1)** provides high-quality data annotation tailored to your needs.
